website_summaries.verdict: The Asics Split Second is built for support. Its web-like overlays on the upper secure the ankle and the foot. Dig in and stand your ground with the help of its sticky split-sole outsole. Its versatility earns it a lot of praises from various athletes.
pros: A majority of people have found the Split Second 9 to be comfortable to use for wrestling, boxing, working out, and even as footwear for martial arts
For its price, this Asics wrestling trainer gives you more than what you pay for, say many users
The grippy outsole performs well on the mat, numerous consumers have noted
Plenty of owners love the ankle lockdown this trainer offers
A lot of testers enjoy the barely-there weight of the footgear
Multiple shoppers have lauded the design of the footwear because it is pleasant looking
cons: More than a few folks have been unhappy with this wrestling shoe’s durability as stitchings ripped and the sole has broken after a few times of use
Something about the overall construction of the Split Second 9 has caused pain in the toes and the arch of some purchasers

customer_reviews.title: Great wrestling shoe - particularly for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: For reasons unknown and unknowable a few years ago the manufacturers of wrestling shoes stopped making them in different widths. So you have to hunt to find wrestling shoes that fit those with wide feet. After trying a number of shoes we found these. We still had to buy 1 1/2 size up - my son usually wears size 7 sneakers and we ordered 8 1/2s - but he can get the ball of his foot into the shoe and it fits comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: ljmiii

customer_reviews.title: Order a size to a size and a half up.
customer_reviews.text: I got this back in 2015 for training and to be completely honest they worked pretty well for their purpose. The only thing was that they run small even in men's sizes so make sure you order a size and a half up. They need to be snug but not too snug. I normally wear an 8 in men's and 10 in women's and got a 9 in men's for this shoe and it was still too tight but I eventually broke them in.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia M. Perea

customer_reviews.title: Finally wrestling shoes for wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: I have flare wide feet. I normally ware men's 13 EE. Pro: Not to expensive $60.00 The toe box was perfect and good ankle support. Con: Cheaper plastic materials. Not sure how it will streach out or withstand torque. Summary: I recommend the Dan Gable Ultimate 4 over Split Second 9 because of the superior traction, flex and ankle support (though not as good for wide feet). If your on a budget, than the split second 9 is a great choice. The Dan Gable also was more of a moccasin style having no actual toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Asics sizing is a problem.
customer_reviews.text: The problem with asics wrestling shoes is that they're not true to size. I almost ordered my exact size but upon reading the reviews I realized I had to go to a brick and mortar store to try them on. Good thing I did. The models in the store required me to go up a size so I ordered this model in that size on clearance. Turns out this model only required a half size increase. Oh well, they still work and I still suck at wrestling plus the price was Hella cheap. Quality seems to be good too and I'm stylin.
customer_reviews.author: McGregor

customer_reviews.title: Good workout shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I prefer a wrestling shoe for weight room workouts and Asics are my favorites. As other reviewers have noted, this shoe runs small. I wear a size 12 in a running shoe (and some of my dress shoes are size 11), but I ordered a size 13 when I bought this shoe, and it fits just right, with no room to spare. I also have a pair of Matflex 4 shoes (also size 13) and their okay - but I think I like the Slit Second 9's a little better - good support and maybe slightly better construction.
customer_reviews.author: Lifterguy

customer_reviews.title: Great for first year to yoir last year of wrestling.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 12 yr. Old son, its his first year wrestling. He loves them, they are a bit wider than the other Asics, he has a wide foot, so the fit is GREAT. I like them because they have a split bottom sole that allows for more grip and flexibility while your on your toes. The color scheme is NICE, my son plans to attend the Air Force Academy, so the blue really stands out.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: good shoes, but you should get a full size ...
customer_reviews.text: good shoes, but you should get a full size bigger than your regular shoe size. I wear 15 normally, and bought a pair size 15. they were so tight I had a hard time walking on them, let alone wrestle. I ended up getting a 17 instead and they fit a lot better. there is a little room in the front but not that gets in the way...
customer_reviews.author: Santos

customer_reviews.title: The size 6.5 in men is really a 7.75 size
customer_reviews.text: It fits snugly and they did suggest I go up a little since the shoes run small but I'm sure I will be stretching it a little as I work them in. Great pair of wrestling shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for heavy weight lifting
customer_reviews.text: I do not wrestle and I do not run, I lift and do very heavy deadlifts, squats, and compound lifts (upwards of 355 lbs) and needed a good shoe that had no rise and kept me close to the ground (and was not those stupid toe shoes). These are perfect. I am a size 13 and they fit perfectly. Great color options, price, and great shoe. You cannot go wrong with these! The only downside is I can't just slip into my shoes at the gym anymore lol
customer_reviews.author: Stealthlead

customer_reviews.title: painful arch
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually barefooted, wearing 5fingersbor sandals. The arch was just too painful so I removed the sole padding from the shoe. It helped but now there's a small buldge on the other side where the arch is. Causes a painful, almost cramping type of pain. Not sure if its the split sole design or what. Other than that the shoesbare great and a mainstay in the wrestling world. Just not for people that can't wear arches
customer_reviews.author: Bond, James Bond

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes, a bit tight in the toe
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes, a bit tight in the toe. They stretched out and fit well but up front were a bit tight.
customer_reviews.author: Not Telling

customer_reviews.title: I bought these shows for kickboxing and they are amazing. I'm a female with a size 7 shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shows for kickboxing and they are amazing. I'm a female with a size 7 shoe and after converting the size the pair actually fit perfectly. Kickboxing requires a certain amount of flexibility in the ankle and arch (shuffling, roundhouse kicks, etc.). This shoe provides excellent flexibility, yet feels sturdy at the ankles without being too stiff. I've worn these for a few months and they have held up well. Definitely will recommended.
customer_reviews.author: thediplomat1124

customer_reviews.title: Consideration for Boxing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for boxing, like most people stated these are on the smaller side so do yourself a favor and go a full size up. At first they felt a little too tight around the toes, but the more you workout in then they'll fit better. My only complaint is that the tongue of the shoe doesn't completely cover your socks. Overall for the price they're pretty solid shoes for boxing.
customer_reviews.author: Alan J.

customer_reviews.title: I like them overall
customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes for krav maga, so I wouldn't typically wear them longer than a workout/class. I like them overall, and bought the size I did based on success with a different model from ASICS. This pair, however, is a little loose or wide in the middle, but that may be due to the lesser amount of soul in the middle, which I think is intentional. I may get used to them or I may wind up putting some small insert (if possible) into the arch/center. Nice looking shoes though!
customer_reviews.author: WSW

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, but they are about a size small, and a bit narrower than I would like them to be. Asics still set the standard for wrestling shoes, but these are just a bit smaller than I would like. These also have a split sole that I am really not a huge fan of just yet. I prefer a full bottom, but I may change my mind once I work with these a little more. Bottom line: good shoe at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: A little busy in design. No ones makes white available anymore
customer_reviews.text: They fit well, not as narrow other wrestling shoes by Asics
customer_reviews.author: Dede

customer_reviews.title: Poorly crafted . . .
customer_reviews.text: My son has written these shoes about 12 times since we bought them. He only wears them on the wrestling mat. The seem down at the bottom of the laces is starting to come apart. I am disappointed in the quality of these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: George Richins

customer_reviews.title: they don't look like the picture (way greyer with hardly any blue
customer_reviews.text: I sent them back. They don't fit (really small-- I ordered the same size I typically wear-- even with other Asics shoes-- and they were TINY. Also, they don't look like the picture (way greyer with hardly any blue, and the detail is shiny plastic-looking)...
customer_reviews.author: John C. (Nik) Bramblett

customer_reviews.title: good mat sneaker
customer_reviews.text: I got these sneakers so i could work out in Combat Systema gym on the mat. They run small, so definitely get at least 1`/2 size up from your regular size. They look well built, and stretch a little after the first time or two wearing them, which I like--you can always lace 'em up tighter. Not a lot of cash for a decent shoe. I recommend if you're not banging the hell out of them 5 x a week.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy Rocker

customer_reviews.title: All-around great shoe for the price
customer_reviews.text: Based on other people's reviews, my kid ordered these a full size bigger than what he normally wears & was very happy with what he got. Haven't had them long enough to vouch for durability, but he tells us they are both comfortable & functional for his purposes on the wrestling team. They were among the cheaper wrestling shoes so I'm glad to have gotten something of good quality without spending too much.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Does it job
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for wrestling on school team. Helped a lot with sliding on mat or being pushed more! Unfortunately grow out of them b4 next season.
customer_reviews.author: April Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Runs a bit small, but very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe a lot. I use it for my Krav Maga class, and it offers awesome protection, while still allowing me to feel the ground and have full range of motion. The size seemed to run a bit small for me, but overall the fit is great (the width is perfect!), and it ties very securely. I have never had to retie it during class.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Dennison

customer_reviews.title: Very good shoes for boxing practice
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit snugly, not going to lie. Then again, when you wear a size 16, everything fits snugly. I tend to sweat a lot when I work out, so after a 50-minute workout (jumping rope, shadowboxing, light bags, heavy bags) the hardwood or linoleum gets slick. Only then does the tread on the shoes feel less than adequate. In the ring, the shoes feel great. I can pivot without shifting my center of balance dramatically, and for jumping rope the additional flexibility in the sole is crucial. They also help out with pushups and quick pivoting immensely. The tread on the toe gives you great grip to take off on sprints, and your ankles feel very secure.
customer_reviews.author: Xionc

customer_reviews.title: This pair better than Dan Gable ultimate 3 asics which the sole blew out after just 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This pair was half the price, and my high school varsity wrestler likes this pair just as well. I thought spending more would result in a better pair. Not the case here. I would order half size up, as you do in almost all asics. They are little tight across foot, but do stretch out as they get worked in. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: celliott

customer_reviews.title: Shoes fit great and give good support and traction
customer_reviews.text: My son got these for his High School wresting team. We tried on a few pairs to get the right size and checked Amazon for good prices. We found he had to get a half size bigger than his normal sneakers. He really likes the style and they fit great. What he really likes is the traction on the bottom. It is just enough to help him keep his feet planted and not slide around, but not too much to constrain mobility. He is very happy with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: HavingFunLiving

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but sized way too small!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a women's size 9, I should be a men's size 7 so I ordered a 7.5 to cover the small size as previous reviewers wrote. They were still too small, I sent them back and ordered a size 8 and they fit perfectly. So these shoes are great, they're comfortable, cheap and they work for my Isshin Jujitsu class, just make sure you order up a size.
customer_reviews.author: Hashu Deikus

customer_reviews.title: Very good wrestling shoes.  A little stiffer than my previous ASICS Wrestling Shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I have another pair of ASICS Wrestling shoes and purchased the same size (different model). These are a little stiffer which may be why they feel tighter. I'm hoping they will loosen up after I break them in. I prefer to wear wrestling shoes for my workouts, I feel I have better foot control. So rarely do I wear more than 2 hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: whizard

customer_reviews.title: 5 since I still like the style I might probably reorder in size
customer_reviews.text: Too small in such a way that usually I am 10.5 which I ordered them but fit my brother who is 8.5 since I still like the style I might probably reorder in size 12
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: They feel good hitting the bag
customer_reviews.text: Solid shoe, especially for the price. I use them for boxing. They feel good hitting the bag, in the ring, jumping rope. I have relatively wide feet and they fit alright. I usually wear an 11.5 sneaker and got a 12, which was the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: John Perna

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe but Undersized
customer_reviews.text: The shoes themselves are pretty good. They are lightweight, are flexible, and have good grip. My only complaint is that the size seems like 1/2 to 1 full size smaller. I usually wear 8.5. These, as 8.5 fit me pretty tight. They do fit though, which to me, says that they are not too undersized.
customer_reviews.author: OverAmbitious

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME !
customer_reviews.text: It went to the wrong address, but because everyone is allowed a mistake from time to time and I love wrestling shoes I went to get them and it was worth the trip. Great fit and sporty. Im not even a wrestler and the look awesome with jeans. Kudos Asics, you have made me a believer.
customer_reviews.author: tvhead

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap shoe for coaching in
customer_reviews.text: Good cheap shoe for coaching in. It has been one season and it already has visible wear near the top. Hope that doesn't mean they will fall apart
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: The best so far for wide feet...
customer_reviews.text: We tried several pairs of wrestling shoes for my son because his feet are very wide. The toe box on these had the most comfortable (widest) fit for him vs. the Nike & Adidas that we ordered first. He says they are lightweight with nice grip.
customer_reviews.author: bwb 0530

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, looks great but could be a little bit better!
customer_reviews.text: Expected to be better reading the reviews but remember do not play basketball or run with these on just for walking around the gym etc and doing squats / deadlifts. they look amazing though, thats always a plus. its a bit narrow, buy 1-2 sizes larger than what you would wear normally.
customer_reviews.author: flexforall1

customer_reviews.title: These shoes will make you pin and/or out point your opponent. Guaranteed.
customer_reviews.text: My kid wears these. Honestly, we chose them because they’re his school colors, but it’s worked out so far. He says they’re comfortable and grippy. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Slingshot

customer_reviews.title: Tiny?!
customer_reviews.text: These were the tiniest sneakers I have ever seen! I wear a Men's size 7; and these were miniscule! The certainly look cool; and cover the ankles which is what I needed. I did not order another pair because I was not sure if I would need an 8 or 8.5 and didn't want to keep returning. So size UP and these are totally cool looking...
customer_reviews.author: ScrappyKel

customer_reviews.title: I'm a 9. 5. Bought a 9. ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 9.5. Bought a 9.5. Could not get my feet in them. Exchanged them for a Cael v6.0 (these turned out to be a bit too flashy for me) in a 10. THESE RUN A HALF TO A FULL SIZE SMALL, BE FOREWARNED!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Block

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: First, buy at least one size bigger. So, if you wear an 9, buy at least a 9.5 as they run small. My feet kept falling asleep on the treadmill. I tried all sorts of shoes. When none helped, I went back to my HS days and got these. They are awesome. Comfortable, great for lifting, running, etc. Plus, they look awesome.
customer_reviews.author: David Scott Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Stellar wrestling shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these wrestling shoes for my grandson, a high schooler. They are cool looking, as he said, but I ordered a regular size, not wide width. I found out later most wrestling shoes run small, unless you can find wide. He returned them and is ordering a larger size, which are also wide width. They are exellent quality and they match his school colors. Returns are so easy with Amazon, it wasn't a problem. I also enjoyed the sale price. Stellar shoes !! Thanks, Amazon
customer_reviews.author: BaBa's profile

customer_reviews.title: Sizes run small
customer_reviews.text: Nice comfy shoes. I got it mainly for lifting weights. I would recomend going a full size up bc they fit really tight. Will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: joe_lee

customer_reviews.title: They fit his foot better than the others
customer_reviews.text: My son has wide, flat feet. I researched a lot of the wrestling shoes and found out that these are about the widest you can get. They fit his foot better than the others, but still a little too narrow. He can wear them for about 2 hours before it becomes painful.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Frey

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sturdy and very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these almost daily mainly for krav maga training mainly because I find them very comfy. They are lightweight yet sturdy, and don't stick to mat which is great for kicks and turns. Not the most aesthetically pleasing especially for training martial arts but who cares. I'd highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Rajesh Ashtaputre

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: Son thinks they look cool and fit as expected. A little narrow but my son is a near EE and it is standard width, so or issue, they are stretching out.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: My kids loved them. They were comfortable and came in the ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved them. They were comfortable and came in the right sizes. They have size 14.5 and 13 in athletic shoes so finding these online was a good deal and to have them fit their wide feet was even better. I'd recommend them to people with wide big feet.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Shoes won't fit an extra wide foot
customer_reviews.text: even though shoe is advertised as being flexible enough to fit wide feet, no way it will fit me. I usually need 4X but can deal with 2X, but this shoe won't make it for me. Even ordered an 11 when I usually wear a 10.
customer_reviews.author: Homer King

customer_reviews.title: Asics Wrestling shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great style and color but ran too narrow for my teenage son (and he does not have wide feet).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great traction on the mat
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son, who is a high school wrestler. He has used these shoes in several matches now and he loves them. Great traction on the mat. Very light and comfortable, even though he has very wide feet and normally wear size E to 3E tennis shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weird because normally asics fit me just fine. THese just run a little different from their ...
customer_reviews.text: Too narrow for me. I wear a size 13 and once your feet are that big, you notice a lot of width problems on some shoes. Weird because normally asics fit me just fine. THese just run a little different from their cross training shoes. Keep it in mind if you have big feet guys.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler n megan

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes!! using them for boxing, and they make me feel light on my feet, and allow for great rotation in my hips through my toes, necessary for extending punches as quickly as possible. day one they felt a tad bit tight, but by the end of the first workout they seemed to break in and became more comfortable. my foot is wider than the average person, I would recommend getting the size that you normally get, some recommend getting a size up, but I wear size 10 normally and these were perfect. Definitely recommend if you're looking for an affordable and fantastic boxing shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Martens

customer_reviews.title: The shoes are comfortable, snug
customer_reviews.text: Just got them yesterday and used them for MMA training. I was tired of stepping on sweaty mats. The shoes are comfortable, snug, soft and flexible. Here's the rundown on size. My regular shoe size is 11wide I went 1 size higher and bought 12m. This size just fits my foot. Like I said before, its snug. So anyone with wide feet, my recommendation is to go 1 entire size higher. If I had bought 11m, I can guarantee it would not have fit.
customer_reviews.author: Zakir

customer_reviews.title: Little Small.....
customer_reviews.text: He loves the style, but the fit is a bit tight. Usually wears 9-9.5. Bought them bigger to last longer. Unfortunately, is brand of wrestling shoes will only last for 1 season. Not looking forward to to paying this price again for the next wrestling round.
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: Beware of size! US 9 is actually 26.5cm and euro 41.5!!!
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is great and just the way I like it. Would've gotten a 5 star if not for the fact that the size chart is absolutely inaccurate and my US9 turns up to be 26.5cm. I live in Singapore so return is a hassle. Thank God my feet can still fit in and takes a loose lace tying and more seasoning to feel better. In the ideal world though I would've picked 27cm shoes obviously. Shame on you seller for being too lazy to put in accurate size chart!
customer_reviews.author: Brian L.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, fit small and are narrow
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son for his wrestling season. He normally wears a 4.5 and I ordered a 5.5. The fit was a little small and on the narrow side. We decided to keep them and they are stretching out and my son has not complained of any discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Kj

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes but width could be improved
customer_reviews.text: With all the wresling shoes out there Could someone do a pair for wresler with larger feet? Make sure you get at least one size up.
customer_reviews.author: Johan

customer_reviews.title: Classic and dependable
customer_reviews.text: My wrestlers prefer the flexibility of the split sole. They may try others, but there is always a pair of split seconds as back-up.
customer_reviews.author: Llenae

customer_reviews.title: Winnner
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boxer and he is really happy with them. Did buy a half size larger which wound up being perfect. He says they are really light weight and are perfect for his style of boxing. If you have never tried ASICS brand you are in for a treat.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: They did rip a small bit on the second wearing by the base of the tongue which alleviated the tightness and made more more comfo
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were more narrow than other Asics wrestling shoes I have owned. They did rip a small bit on the second wearing by the base of the tongue which alleviated the tightness and made more more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: R.K. of VA

customer_reviews.title: Says they are very comfortable and supportive for his ankles
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these new wrestling shoes. Says they are very comfortable and supportive for his ankles. He would definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne Olson

customer_reviews.title: The size chart is bad.
customer_reviews.text: It is not my fault that the size chart is wrong and I have to pay for the product. The provider must assume the costs and the only solution that gives me is a phone number that is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Mesias

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. My son loves it. He needed a shoe with wide width but since we couldn't find one, we ordered one size up. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Finley

customer_reviews.title: so good
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my son. he likes them , so good review
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Walk

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Since I bought these for my son, I don't have any personal experience with these shoes other than second-hand info from my son, who is very happy with them. He did his research and found these particular shoes to be the ones he wanted. They were in his performance and price range. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chang One

customer_reviews.title: fit great
customer_reviews.text: i only use these for coaching and they are holding up well but i really would expect them to fit very well, i went up a half size because i have wider feet and i could have stayed with my normal size
customer_reviews.author: robb boutelle

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not ideal. I bought them in my size for tennis shoes and they were too small for me. They may have worked great had they been the right size, but I'm not going to waste more money to find out. If you buy, go up a size!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Just thumbs up 👍
customer_reviews.text: I've got this Asics wrestling shoes for my partner He worn this morning when he did boxing class well he was so happy because he felt it was really lite n he could even run around like bear foot Amazing design with great price,, I'm actually addicted to look at more shoes on amazon website lately which isn't really good lol ( spend too much money but saving also happening at same time ) Anyway it is really good choice n I will keep looking for resonable price of shoes because we can't really get this valuable shoes in Australia unfortunately Thanks amazon !!
customer_reviews.author: Helen An

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes for the purpose, i do krav maga and spend a lot of time on the mats, these shoe is very versatile , you can do wrestling, boxing or kicking with no problem , it felt like it was too tigh the first few weeks but now feel perfect so order the same size you wear in regular snickers
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: ASICS wrestling shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit my niece perfectly! She absolutely loved them. She opened the box and was extremely happy. Her words were, "they are so beautiful!". She won all four of her matches the next day! Im not saying that the shoes made her win, but I'm almost sure it gave her that extra umph!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes: good arch support, narrow foot bed. I wear 11.5 in others shoes, got these in 12, and they are still pretty snug, although stretching somewhat with wear.
customer_reviews.author: Sonador

customer_reviews.title: Please include a size guide!
customer_reviews.text: Sizes aren't anywhere near accurate. This may be the case for wrestling shoes but there is no guide or information for a first time buyer. I don't fault Asics here as much as Amazon for the lack of buyer information. This seems like a product better bought in stores, unfortunately finding them in my area proved difficult!
customer_reviews.author: Sal Pugliese

customer_reviews.title: Order 1.5-2 sizes up
customer_reviews.text: I bought it 1.5 sizes larger than my normal shoe size, it's still too small and narrow
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... 30 years and this is the fist pair to disappoint me. They fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have wore ASICS for over 30 years and this is the fist pair to disappoint me. They fit as expected. i have wore them less then 10 times and the stitching on the left foot by the big toe has has come completely out. Very disappointed since i use these shoes for just wrestling shows while reffing. My old pair are over 10 years old and the stitching is still holding. They look great but dont hold up.
customer_reviews.author: jerry g.

customer_reviews.title: One shoe tighter than the other reoredered 10.5 and was satisfied
customer_reviews.text: One shoe seemed smaller than the other. Other than that they are nice shoes. I reordered 10.5 and they fit better a little tight but will stretch a bit with wear. I think the one shoe was just put together a bit off. The 10.5s seemed identical in size and shape unlike the 10. Amazon pays for the return shipping and the replacements arrived a day earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: N. COLLINS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wrestling shoe
customer_reviews.text: It has an even, snug fit with enough give to make it very comfortable. Well-made with flexible support for the foot. It runs about 1/2 size small. We found that a Nike running shoe size 8 translates into a size 8.5 in this Split Second 9 ASICS. Keep this in mind when you order.
customer_reviews.author: kteacher2010

customer_reviews.title: 12-1/2 fit true to size
customer_reviews.text: Fit is close to the foot giving good feeling of contact with the mat. Quality feels good but looks plastic and cheap. Sole feels a little too rounded side to side and I felt my balance was slightly compromised; I would prefer a flatter sole.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: wrong size!!! shoes come 1full size smaller!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok I am giving it a 4 star even though I haven't put them to practice....it's because the shoes come 1 full size smaller! For example, if you wear 10 Men size...that should be 28cm but the shoes are actually 27cm!
customer_reviews.author: Adani Chiamatto

customer_reviews.title: Go up one full size
customer_reviews.text: I'm unable to give my best evaluation on these shoes due to the size being too small. I recommend ordering one size bigger than you normally wear. I wear a 10.5 which is what I ordered, but they are one full size too small.
customer_reviews.author: Trekaychris

customer_reviews.title: First shoes since 1997
customer_reviews.text: These are my first wrestling shoes since 1997 and I freaking love them. Not only are they comfortable, but they move so easily and snap into position quick. Love em! I wish I had a pair like this when I was going live and not just coaching
customer_reviews.author: CinemaEditor

customer_reviews.title: A 3 star because they aren't true to size
customer_reviews.text: These are great quality shoes. The fit is too small. I have worn several different styles of Asics shoes over the years and they are always sized perfect. These were short. If not for the sizing issue, these would get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: M. White

customer_reviews.title: Great grip for a wrestling shoe
customer_reviews.text: Thought I ordered 11.5 but I guess not but the shoe held up well my whole wrestling season and still has enough grip to last me my senior year so I like them It matches my school color an looks awesome
customer_reviews.author: calvin

customer_reviews.title: Shoes fit me great Im a size 13 but my feet are not ...
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit me great Im a size 13 but my feet are not wide thankfully. I do suggest people with wider feet to buy half a size larger if possible. As for the shoes they feel great, had a 90 minute power boxing session with them and I was very impressed with the shoes. A bit too flashy for my liking but I was getting complimented on them a lot. Very good shoes for the price, would recommend them to anyone... Wish I had ordered 2-3 pairs to keep as backup cause I hate waiting for shipping, but I was worried about the size. All in all 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ergham Al Bachir

customer_reviews.title: Liked the design but they wouldn't fit.
customer_reviews.text: We were hoping these would fit as it is impossible to find a decent shoe for this size. It appeared to offer great ankle support. We ended up having to return it as my son could not get much more than 3 toes in the shoe. :(
customer_reviews.author: RaeL

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes even though it might not look the coolest it works great and is durable. I have had mines for a couple of months and it still looks brand new
customer_reviews.author: Juniot Francois

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit, but comfy
customer_reviews.text: My feet are narrow so the fit is ok for me, but I could see how there could be an issue for wider or flatter feet. I order a half size higher than my Asics running shoes and the fit is snug, but comfortable. Have only had one workout with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: TKD shoe
customer_reviews.text: we got this for my hubby to use in karate class because he is diabetic and all the work out tended to cause his feet to split, and the shoes prevent it yet they work great on the mat and inside spar gear. only they run small and he has to completely unlace the entire shoe each time he wears them and re lace them once on.
customer_reviews.author: LISA ROUGEAU

customer_reviews.title: You MUST get a full size larger
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy that I read the comments below before buying these shoes. I usually wear a size 10 but after seeing everyone saying how small these shoes actually are I decided to take a risk and buy a size 11. Boy am I happy I did because these barely fit with size 11's. They seriously need to fix the sizes on these.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Rod

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son in a size 11; he typically wears about a size 10.5. They are a little bit too big, so you can confidently order your regular shoe size. His wrestling season was only 3.5 weeks long; by the end, there was some wear on the shoes at the "bendy" spots. I'm a little disappointed at that, but when I look at how much some people spend on wrestling shoes, it is clear you get what you pay for. I'm just not ready or willing to spend upwards of $150 for shoes that will only fit my kid for MAYBE two seasons.
customer_reviews.author: madime39

customer_reviews.title: ... he loves how they fit and they give him great support for
customer_reviews.text: purchased these for my son and he loves how they fit and they give him great support for wrestling
customer_reviews.author: Eli T.

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe - runs small.
customer_reviews.text: This wrestling shoe is a good value for the money, but it runs small. My son needed a size bigger than he usually wears. Wrestling shoes are generally not comfortable, these are probably not any worse or better than most wrestling shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Expert Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Run small
customer_reviews.text: My son normally wears a 6 or 6.5. Based on reviews, I bought a 6.5 and his toes are to the very end. I’m returning them for a 7.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great wrestling shoes. Takes a little time to break in, but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Looks fantastic, quality shoe, order 1/2 a size up
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 42 which is 8.5 US, i've ordered half a size up (9) as recommended and it's actually tight on the feet.I also noticed that these kinds of shoes need to be broken in as they do in fact stretch out after usage.so it's fine if it's tight at first. It's a pretty solid shoe for weightlifting, doing squats, power cleans. its also light weight.
customer_reviews.author: M. Abdullatif

customer_reviews.title: Great but narrow shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits very narrowly. Otherwise an excellent shoe overall.
customer_reviews.author: B. MCGAVOCK

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pair
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these and wore out a pair of these between the month long JRob camp and the first half of this year's wrestling season...and if the boy is happy, Dad's happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tanakaba

customer_reviews.title: great shoe
customer_reviews.text: these are great shoes. they do run a little small. like all other wrestling shoes i tried. i wear an 11.5 in regular shoes. if you adjust for them fitting a little small they are great.
customer_reviews.author: todd b.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have great grip and where comfortable to wear. They fit my foot perfectly. The only downside is that the tread starting coming off the bottom by the end of the season. Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Threading hasn't been done well
customer_reviews.text: Threading started to unravel near the first eyelet / tongue on first usage, this is the second pair that I purchased, first pair did the exact same thing. The shoe itself is great, just need to get better quality control, or a better threading machine / cheap labor.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Petraborg

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, Small size
customer_reviews.text: This wrestling shoe is my first pair of wrestling shoe, so i can't tell you how good it is compare to others, But at least i feel good. It comes in 1/2 size small, so be ware to buy a 1/2 size lager or you have to wait another 5 days for exchange.
customer_reviews.author: stark

customer_reviews.title: Good light shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good light shoe. Everyone said to buy one size bigger and I did not and sent them back twice. By that time I decided I did not need them. Customer serivce was good.
customer_reviews.author: coleman6924

customer_reviews.title: These are Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to work out in. I love them on my heavy bag workouts, they are super comfortable, don't bother me even during heavy kicking. After I run, I pop these on and do the rest of my workout in them.
customer_reviews.author: A. Muma

customer_reviews.title: Recommend to order one or two size larger than your size
customer_reviews.text: I initially ordered 7.5 which was my regular shoe size. But it was too small for these wrestling shoes and ended up with 8.5 to feel comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: White

product_meta.title: ASICS - Mens Split Second 9 Footwear Shoes
product_meta.description: For wrestlers looking for a superior wrestling shoe at an equally superior value. The Split Sole and Asymmetrical Lacing Design enhance on-mat traction, performance, and maneuverability. Comes in dynamic color patterns.
feature_bullets: An anatomically correct lacing environment that reduces potential for irritation and provides improved comfort and fit.
